items.title: Dropdown with sub-categories Pattern Submission
items.body: Description: Menus with category labels Overview: There is already a pattern for menus with options that are grouped using lines. This pattern builds on that for the case where category labels are necessary to make scanning options easier. When To Use: • Only use this option if there is a reasonable number of options that makes categorizing necessary • Include a search field in the menu to make finding an option easier and faster • Sub-groups are optional • Avoid categories that have fewer than 3 options 1. Search bar 2. Category label: productive-heading-01 3. Category divider line: 1px line 4. Sub-category divider line: 1px line, lighter color than the Category divider line Anatomy Best practices: Use categories only when the list of options is too long. Use sub-categories when there are many options under categories and, to make scanning easier. Keyboard Accessibility: Users can tab through the checkbox and primary/secondary buttons. Up and down arrows activated once focus is inside the options area to navigate up or down. Option can be activated by clicking on enter/return.

items.body:
### Package

carbon-components, carbon-components-react

### Browser

Chrome

Windows

7.51

### Automated testing tool and ruleset

keyboard

### Assistive technology

keyboard

### Description

Steps for vanilla:
- https://www.carbondesignsystem.com/components/dropdown/usage/#live-demo
- focus the example Dropdown and quickly type Option 4
- this should select Option 4, but the space opens the Dropdown and Option 2 is actually selected (because of #10628)

Steps for react:
- https://react.carbondesignsystem.com/?path=/story/components-dropdown--default
- focus the example Dropdown and quickly type Option 4
- space opens the Dropdown and Option 1 is selected

If the Dropdown is open, then typing Option 4 closes the Dropdown because that's the normal behavior of the space key.

I would expect [space to be added to the search string when using typeahead](https://github.com/openui/open-ui/issues/171#issuecomment-686016533), and not used to open/close the Dropdown.

_No response_

items.title: Dropdown menus should overlay scrollable areas
items.body:
### Summary

If a dropdown is used within a scrollable area they will be cut off by the surrounding container. This leads to broken layouts or even actions impossible to access.
Example (dropdown hidden by scrollable area and actions can't be accessed):
![dropdown-scroll-issue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3808948/104612812-dee3a780-5686-11eb-9dc0-e04d9afc5de8.gif)
Try it [here (IBM internal)](https://pages.github.ibm.com/conrad-schmidt/wkc-patterns-showcase/#/user-modal)

Currently only the DatePicker supports an `appendTo` option, which would solve this issue.
This issue can't be resolved from the `outside` (css, add-ons, js, ...) - only the Carbon components itself can fix this issue, that is why it is so hard to deal with. 

### Justification

This issue occurs in several products:
- Watson Knowledge Catalog (WKC)
- Cloud PAK for Data (CPD)
- Also covered in this [Slack discussion](https://ibm-analytics.slack.com/archives/CPZH52RDE/p1607629066050400)
- And other (see https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon/issues/6288) 

### Desired UX and success metrics

<!--alex disable failure-->

The dropdown should overlay the scrollable container.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3808948/104614304-6c73c700-5688-11eb-8ff7-73acbd693265.png)

<!--alex enable failure-->

### "Must have" functionality

The dropdown should overlay the scrollable container (see above).

### Specific timeline issues / requests

<!--alex disable period-->

As soon as possible, because there features which should be shipped by **begin of February**. Currently the design is **asked to design around this issue**, which shouldn't be the case.

<!--alex enable period-->

_NB: The Carbon team will try to work with your timeline, but it's not
guaranteed. The earlier you make a request in advance of a desired delivery
date, the better!_

### Available extra resources

What resources do you have to assist this effort?

[Modal with dropdown issue(IBM internal)](https://pages.github.ibm.com/conrad-schmidt/wkc-patterns-showcase/#/user-modal)
[Dialog appendTo plugin](https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon/blob/3361b8046013eb95d4fc88107384d8202f6c2468/packages/react/src/components/DatePicker/plugins/appendToPlugin.js)
[Existing issue](https://github.com/carbon-design-system/carbon/issues/6288)


_Carbon is a collaborative system. We encourage teams to build components and
submit them for integration as either add-ons or core components._

items.title: Update to the Carbon “actions toolbar” to allow for dropdown-menu buttons.
items.body:
Overview
The current toolbar pattern only allows for single-action buttons which limits the number of actions that can be used -- especially when considering translation and small-window formats. The proposed pattern would allow the number of actions to scale by using dropdown-menu buttons. Menus can also be divided into categories following the “overflow menu” pattern.

![AB1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/96617414/148364144-1eac3510-c463-41d6-8075-3ca4e100f531.png)
_Current pattern with action-buttons in the tool bar of a default window size_

![AB2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/96617414/148364202-4a8129b2-04dd-4053-8a19-229f4af48b0d.png)
_New pattern with menu-buttons in the tool bar of a default window size_

![AB3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/96617414/148364328-a488ad09-645e-4f49-9d50-f9adcdcd8e6d.png)
_New pattern with an open dropdown menu in the tool bar_

![AB4](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/96617414/148364405-32efd5ac-3b47-455c-9a08-a937e29207ae.png)
_New pattern with use of mixed action-buttons and menu-button in the toolbar_

**When to use**
This pattern would be used when there isn’t enough space on the toolbar to accommodate the list of actions. This could be because -	
• there are too many actions (more than 5) -	
• one or more action labels are long (by default or when translated) 
• the design needs to respond to a narrow window size (overflow menu)

**When not to use** 
This pattern should not be used if there is enough space to accommodate the actions as buttons in a default window size. 

**Behaviors**
Button states : Enabled, hover, active, focus and disabled menu-button states should be the same as the action-button (also Carbon primary button and Cloud menu button)

**Menu states:**	
• Open and close behaviors should be consistent with the Carbon “overflow” menu behaviors (also Cloud menu button)
• Open and close motion of the menu should be consistent with the Carbon “overflow” menu (also Cloud menu button) 
• Enabled, hover, active, focus and disabled menu states should be the same as the overflow menu (also Cloud button menu)

![AB5](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/96617414/148365173-b86bc35b-91fe-4b9d-8402-d1516468e133.png)
Example of “active” button state, divided menu

**Best practices** 
Limit the number of menu-buttons to the amount that can be accommodated in a default window size. 
Follow current Carbon standards for content:
• Button labels should be noun (not verb), and they should accurately describe the options contained in the menu 
• Menu options should be verb+noun and should be clear and concise. They should match the tear sheet, slide-in or confirmation window title.

**Keyboard Accessibility** 
Follow existing accessibility guidelines for the data table, actions toolbar and overflow menu.
